answers.answer: No. HbA1C of 6.2% is well within the normal limits of all Diabetic association guidelines. Also Fasting Blood Sugar of 88mg/dL is normal.This is in case if he is not on any anti-diabetic medication. Otherwise I would call it well controlled Diabetes.Allthough an assessment if he has Pre-diabetes needs to be done by his body weight and OGTT test.

"HbA1C of 6.2% is well within the normal limits of all Diabetic association guidelines."Not entirely true as the lab range max'd out at 6.0%. Some labs go as high as 7% but in your husbands case, his doctors lab feels he has entered the area of diabetes. Its best to discuss this with his doctor.

question: Hi Doctor ,My  husband  underwent a  blood test . His   lab  result  shows1. fasting  blood   sugar as  882.hgba1c as  6.2   (  standard  range mentioned   as  4.5  to 6.0 )Does this result mean    he  is  having   diabetes
title: confusing   lab result
